intro: Tetranthera lanceifolia, commonly known as the lanceleaf tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Tetranthera lanceifolia is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
